intro: Galium hercynicum var. arvernense, commonly known as the Arvernian bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, aiding in its propagation.
